lines.text: Your father was a wonderful man to love - but not to live with.
It always troubled me, the Trinity. You know, Giuseppe, I could never really understand it. Does it trouble you?
No. There are three persons in one God. Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. Three in one.
Yes, but that's for a child. But a small comfort to a Bishop. You see, I'm a peasant, Giuseppe, just like you. A practical man, so I understand only what I feel, and what I see.
Look, look. One blanket and one, two, three folds. Three folds in one blanket - three persons in one God, like the Trinity.
Brother Giuseppe! I knew you'd be here someday.

[overjoyed that the Bishop remembers him]
Your Excellency.
How are the lambs?
Oh, they are sheep now, your Excellency.
Oh yes, of course. Has it been that long? And the studies - they've been hard, eh?

[sighs and nods]
But mostly I miss the stables. That's where I really belong, I shouldn't be here.
Let me be the judge of that, Giuseppe. There will be many lost sheep to care for.
Look at him. Do you really believe there is a devil lurking inside that humble young man?
There was once a Lucifer in heaven.
Father Giuseppe! What are they doing to you?
It's for my own good, little brother. Father Raspi is driving out the devil.
The devil? You? Oh, no, you're a saint. He's a saint!
Take that blasphemous fool out of here.
Charity and love are capital virtues, Brother Giuseppe, but my favorite virtue is promptness.
You? A priest? Then I should be a bishop! Or the pope even!

They have thrown you out. They don't want you back because you are an idiot. You have been nothing but trouble since the day you got there - since the day you were born! What have you done this time? Tell me. Answer!
I broke a statue.
For breaking a little statue they throw you out like a dog?
It wasn't little, it was big.
You have a whole year to prepare yourself, with the best instructors of the order.
I'll miss the stables.
Gobbo will look after the animals.
Father Giovanni, couldn't I stay...
No.
No.
I will work harder than...
No, Giuseppe.
Just to stay...
Obedience, Giuseppe, is the first rule.

Giuseppe, Giuseppe. Do you think I kept you in school all these years for this piece of paper? Do you think it didn't break my heart to see you, a grown man, among school boys? But at least I knew where you were, a place to go every day where the Sisters could look after you. Now - what will I do with you? What will you do with yourself?
Recite the 14th chapter of the first epistle to the Corinthians.
What man of you, having a thousand sheep, and losing one of them...
No, look again! I said Corinthians! There is more to scripture than the gospel of Saint Luke!
But I like Saint Luke.
That's beside the point. You've got to know the entire bible. Now, the 14th chapter of the first epistle to the Corinthians...
How I envy you.
Next year you will be standing here, and I will be your alter boy.
I hope so!
